questions.question: 1. A group of people related by blood or through legal means is known as...
2. Which of the following is NOT a way that families are expected to help/support their members?

choices.answer: Sharing and passing down family traditions
Providing a safe trial and error environment

questions.question: 3. A family relationship is between parents and children only.
4. Families can help teach you morals, values, and social skills.
5. The first stage of the family life cycle is?
6. A mother, father, and two children are an example of which type of family?
7. Competition and fighting between brothers and sisters are known as a...
8. Which of the following is NOT a VOLUNTARY deduction taken out of a paycheck?
9. Why is it important to have savings?

choices.answer: Expected expenses (like a down payment for a car)
Unexpected expenses (like needing to replace a broken appliance)
Monthly expenses if you are unable to get paid  (like rent)

questions.question: 10. How much money should you have in savings?

choices.answer: None you should  live paycheck to paycheck
It is a card you recieve from a lending institution that loans you money.
It is a card linked to your bank checking account.

questions.question: 12. Which of the following is true about credit cards?

choices.answer: The more credit cards you have the more important you are.
You should max out your spending limits on your credit card.
You should always pay more than your minimum payment on your credit card.
You should apply for the first credit card that sends you an application.

questions.question: 13. Why can having a credit card be beneficial?

choices.answer: a. It's easier than carrying around cash.
b. It makes making purchases online more secure than using a debit card.
c. You can buy lots of stuff now and worry about paying it back later.

questions.question: 14. Inappropriate behavior at work can get an employee fired and can also make it difficult to get a good referral.
15. Employers will want to invest in a young worker with a great attitude even if the person does not have perfect skill

choices.answer: A person that works for free
A person that works for several different employers
A  person that starts their own business, taking on all the risk and reward
A person that has worked their way up to the top of their field
Identify the knowledge and skills learners need as they follow a pathway
They tell you what to do with your life
They force you to follow a specific path the get a job

questions.question: 20. Minimum wage is $11.80 an hour. if you worked full time for one year (2080 hours) What would the yearly salary be?
